sense.name: spoken language
sense.commentary: speech communications, spoken communication, voice communication, oral communication, manner of speaking, delivery - language or manner of speaking
sense.examples: His speech was garbled. He recorded the speech of the streets. His speech was quite abrupt. Her speech was barren of southernisms. I detected a slight accent in his speech.

sense.name: the words
sense.commentary: actor's line, words - words making up dialogue (often of a play)
sense.examples: He could hear them uttering merry speeches. The actor forgot his speech.

sense.name: lecture
sense.commentary: talking to - a lengthy rebuke, a reprimand
sense.examples: A good speech was my father's idea of discipline. The teacher gave him a speech.

sense.name: act of addressing
sense.commentary: SPEECH[+event] formal address - the act of delivering a formal spoken communication to an audience
sense.examples: He listened to an address on minor Roman poets. His speech lasted for almost an hour.

sense.name: ability to speak
sense.commentary: language - the mental faculty or power of vocal communication (typically linguistics jargon)
sense.examples: Speech sets homo sapiens apart from all other animals.
